attributes.action: Brexit deal must contain a clause allowing us rejoin the EU on the same terms
attributes.background:
As a form of insurance against a potentially destructive Brexit we the undersigned petition the government to include a clause in any deal with the EU to allow us to rejoin on the exact same terms we are on now.

This will give us the ultimate get out clause if Brexit is as damaging as predicted.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to vaccinate your children
attributes.background: Intentionally not vaccinating children, except in cases where there are health risks, should not be allowed. It increases the risks of infection to the child and to other children.
attributes.additional_details:
On the 20th August 2018 it was revealed by Public Health England that in the first half of 2018 there were over 800 cases of measles, almost four times as many as there were in the entirety of 2017. 

According to the NHS, 4 out of the 6 vaccinations given to 1 and 2 year olds showed decreases in immunisations which is a worrying development. 
 
France has already made immunizations a legal requirement.
 
Between 2004 and 2014 there were nearly 10,000 cases of Measles and over 81,000 cases of mumps

attributes.action: Ban Concentrated Animal feeding Operations (CAFO) in the UK
attributes.background: CAFOs are common in the US, but are now beginning to appear in the UK. These huge industrial farms are inhumane and should not be allowed in this country. We believe they should be banned on animal welfare grounds.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/environment/2018/may/29/revealed-industrial-scale-beef-farming-comes-to-the-uk

https://www.thebureauinvestigates.com/stories/2017-07-17/intensive-numbers-of-intensive-farming

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/the-controversial-mega-dairies-that-alarm-campaigners-and-divide-a-struggling-sector-of-british-a6744511.html%3famp

www.telegraph.co.uk/pets/news-features/does-uk-really-want-mega-farms/amp/

attributes.action: Urge the UN to refer Southern Cameroons (SC) impasse to the ICJ.
attributes.background: There are serious human rights violations taking place in the Anglophone-speaking areas of Cameroon including killings, arrests, torture, disappearances, rape and the razing of whole villages after protests against assimilation. The SC impasse must be referred to the ICJ to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
In 1961, instead of properly decolonising SC, Britain and the United Nations effectively annexed SC to RC. After unjustly ruling out full independence for SC, the self rule envisaged by UNGA Res 1608 (XV) of 21/04/61 in a federation of two states equal in status was never properly implemented. Today, our Anglo-Saxon educational, legal, economic and socio-cultural systems are under attack by RC assimilationists. 

We want the ICJ to rule in favour of a referendum for us to determine our future.

attributes.action: The right to register with two GPs for students studying away from home
attributes.background: Currently in the UK, you can only register to one GP (General Practitioner) at a time. People tend to register to the one nearest to their home address, but what if you're constantly going back and forth between two addresses? This is a problem students studying away from home have to face.
attributes.additional_details:
During each year of study, students receive 3 main holidays, this includes 3-4 weeks at Christmas and Easter and almost 3 months summer holiday. It is not uncommon to need health treatment during these periods, however, receiving the care needed can be a nightmare!

Not all GPs offer temporary registration, imagine the hassle of constantly having to re-register between two GPs. This also causes unnecessary inconvenience for GPs who constantly have to send patients files and data back and forth.

attributes.action: Fund research into carbohydrate polymers as an alternative to plastic
attributes.background: As you are aware, in the UK we create tonnes of plastic waste daily and this is becoming an increasing problem. We need to cut down on the plastic we are using. To overcome this, we can use carbohydrate polymers (cellophane) but the problem is there is not enough funding to support research into it.

attributes.action: Stop all animal testing in the UK
attributes.background: Animals are dying from animal testing and it isn’t fair on them as they have lives that they should be able to live

attributes.action: Enact an Environmental Law
attributes.background: Since the BBC 1 broadcasting of the Blue Planet (Oceans) showing the harm caused to marine life by plastic packaging there has been a public outcry.
attributes.additional_details:
Supermarket chains should be compelled (by law) to publish on their web sites their use of three categories of plastic packaging.

1) Single Use Plastic 
2) Recyclable Plastic 
3) 100% biodegradable plastic 

And all as a percentage of their total plastic packaging. - Doing this would enable consumers to make choices as to where they shop, and what purchases they make not just on price but additionally and importantly on environmental sustainability.

attributes.action: Fund more services to Walsall by looking at reopening old lines and stations.
attributes.background: I am writing to please ask the government to look into reopening the old lines around Walsall like the Sutton Park Line, South Staffordshire Line, Walsall-Wolverhampton Line and to please add services to Wellington, Stafford, Shropshire, Wolverhampton (Direct) and to other places in England.

attributes.action: Ask Esther McVey to make a further statement to Parliament
attributes.background: Esther McVey's apology over her misrepresentation of the National Audit Office's report into Universal Credit does not stand up to scrutiny. She needs to further explain how she came to be using words that were the polar opposite to the report.

attributes.action: Require cars to be impounded or crushed for leaving dogs in hot cars.
attributes.background: Unfortunately we see so many dogs left in hot cars during peak summer periods due to owners whom haven't a clue. Although social media are widely broadcasting this they still leave dogs in cars. The fear of your pride and joy being crushed may just be the wake up call they need.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to determine the will of the people for NHS and care funding.
attributes.background: Reports by respected institutions such as the IFS, OBR and Nuffield Trust indicate that NHS funding per person is budgeted to fall and that future spending needs to rise to meet patient demand. Despite this, the Government refuses to increase funding even to match that of other wealthy countries.
attributes.additional_details: To remove politics as far as possible, hold a UK referendum on whether to establish an independent Commission to decide how to fund both the NHS and social care or leave it to Governments to decide. Voters would be choosing between continuing as now or having an independent Commission to set strategic funding plans, based upon need and not ideology, for Governments follow.

attributes.action: Take the UK out of the EU's Customs Union in 2021 as promised.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned are deeply unhappy that the Government has decided to keep the UK in the Customs Union beyond the Brexit transition/implementation period.
attributes.additional_details: We further reject the use of the Irish Border "problem" as the reason for this decision (the so-called "backstop") and therefore call upon the British Government to immediately reverse this decision and keep its promise to the British people that the UK will be leaving the Customs Union at the end of the transition/implementation period in 2021.

attributes.action: Debate scrapping the television licence fee and discuss other funding options.
attributes.background: We currently pay £147 per year for a TV licence, the bulk of which goes to the BBC, very little BBC programming these days is of the quality expected, please debate in the Commons with regards scrapping this fee and discuss more viable funding options.

attributes.action: Get the UK to ban all single use plastic items by 2030.
attributes.background:
Around 8 million tons of plastic enter the oceans each year, which is like emptying a garbage truck of plastic into an ocean every minute.

Governments MUST realize that the convenience of plastic is not worth the harm it causes

attributes.action: Prevent persons on the sex offenders register from running a licensed premises
attributes.background:
There are numerous licences premises being run leased and occupied by convicted sex offenders in this country. 
I have been told that this is within the law. 
In my opinion and many others this should not be allowed.

attributes.action: Ban Gambling Adverts Pre-Watershed
attributes.background:
This petition aims to get the government to introduce legislation to ban gambling adverts from being shown pre-watershed. 

Gambling is a huge problem in the UK, last year a Gambling Commission report finds more than 2 million people are addicted to gambling or at risk of developing a problem [1].
attributes.additional_details: [1] https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/aug/24/problem-gamblers-uk-gambling-commission-report

attributes.action: Make well-being and mental health an integrated part of PSHE from KS1 to KS4.
attributes.background: PSHE currently includes Sex Education along with skills to manage finances but does not seem to address the prevalent issue of mental health. The inclusion of well-being and mindfulness within these lessons are vital beginning to tackle this issue of poor mental health amongst young people.
attributes.additional_details:
PSHE on Gov.uk website.
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/personal-social-health-and-economic-education-pshe/personal-social-health-and-economic-pshe-education

Statistics on Mental Health 
https://www.theguardian.com/mental-health-research-matters/2017/jan/20/12-statistics-to-get-you-thinking-about-mental-health-in-young-people

https://www.mind.org.uk/information-support/types-of-mental-health-problems/statistics-and-facts-about-mental-health/how-common-are-mental-health-problems/#.WueVqujwbrc

attributes.action: Abolish PIP assessments in England
attributes.background: Disabled people will not have to go through "unnecessary" medical checks to claim benefits under Scotland's new social security system, according to the minister in charge. Disabled people should have equal rights in England. PIP assessments should be abolished.

attributes.action: Introduce consequences of prolonged pornography use into sex education
attributes.background: Symptoms of porn addiction include intense feelings of depression, shame and isolation, a disintegration of relationships with family and friends, loss of interest in non-porn activities such as school, socialising, exercise and trouble in school. Children must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Mary Anne Layden, called porn the ‘most concerning thing to psychological health that I know of existing today.’ “The internet is a perfect drug delivery system because you are anonymous, aroused and have role models for these behaviours,”. “To have drugs pumped into your house 24/7, free, and children know how to use it better than grown-ups — it’s a perfect delivery system if we want to have a whole generation of young addicts who will never have the drug out of their minds,” she added.

"If we, as a society, shy away from talking about this issue, we are failing the thousands of young people it is affecting" Peter Liver.

The younger the user, the greater the neural response to porn, potentially for the long-term (Cambridge University Study).

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for workers under 18 years old.
attributes.background: The minimum wage for all will rise in April of 2018, but that of under 18s by a lesser amount. Young people between the ages of 16 and 18 may sustain themselves for a variety of reasons, and it is limiting, unnecessary and frankly insulting to be legally paid almost half the wage of our colleagues.
attributes.additional_details:
The gov website on the National Minimum Wage states that 'Typical hourly earnings for 16-17 year olds were £5.15 in 2014 and £6.53 for 18-20 year olds (both excluding apprentices). This compares to £11.74 for workers aged 21 and over.'

www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/property/first-time-buyer-age-increase-1960s-housing-market-cost-property-ladder-a8244501.html%3famp

www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/money/2014/jan/21/record-levels-young-adults-living-home-ons

attributes.action: Use 'Reverse Vending Machines' to recycle glass, plastic and cans in the UK
attributes.background:
I am aiming to achieve higher awareness of recycling in the UK, and to implement recycling further and make it easier. 
Systems such as this are already implemented in other countries in Europe, such as Germany, where they have been proven to work well, and I hope that this will work in the UK.

attributes.action: Stop possible second referendum on E.U. membership
attributes.background: There is a growing band of people that want to reverse the result of the democratic vote of this country to leave the European Union and are calling for a second referendum. This is mainly by the people that lost the vote two years ago and cannot accept the democratic vote of the majority decision.
attributes.additional_details: Although not legally, binding the referendum on whether we stay or leave the EU carried out on the 23rd June 2016 was the clearest indication of the will of the electorate. At that time our Prime Minister David Cameron assured us that the result of the referendum would be carried out. We must ensure the democracy rules

attributes.action: Create a new permanent national UK bank holiday: "Bank holiday of Pride."
attributes.background: 2017 marked 50 year anniversary for decriminalization of homosexuality- all we got were apologies (some posthumously).
attributes.additional_details: 2018 marked 30 years since Section 28 Education clause was removed-again apology but couched with "it was protecting children". Now there are debates about trans issues and the Gender Recognition Act.

attributes.action: Ban the use of flammable cladding on all buildings
attributes.background: The Grenfell Tower disaster shows clearly that the use of flammable cladding should be banned on all buildings.

attributes.action: Make bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Bullying can drive people to have mental health problems, to self-harm and even to suicide because we are all human.
attributes.additional_details: If someone is reported for bullying, they should have a police warning. If they continue should be arrested and imprisoned for 24hrs. If they still continue then they should do community service. We need to crack down on bullying on all levels.

attributes.action: Make piercing any part of a child’s body illegal under the age of 10
attributes.background: It should be illegal for children under the age of 10 to have piercings of any kind (including ears). A child who does not understand the implications of piercings should not have them. A baby or toddler cannot verbally consent and should not have holes put into their body.
attributes.additional_details: Many people grow up to have uneven ear piercings and believe they should have been able to make the choice over what happens to their own body.

attributes.action: Revoke Section 74 of the LLA Act 2007 that permits the reuse of graves
attributes.background: Section 74 of the London Local Authorities Act 2007 permits a burial authority to disturb human remains for the purposes of re-using the graves, but Cemeteries are failing to locate people who may have an inherited right. The current procedure is not adequate to identify potential owners of graves.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls upon Government to develop new legislation in this field to ensure re-use of graves is only permitted where permission from the grave owner or their relatives, as defined by the regulation, is given.

Graves and memorials provide a tangible link to our past, assist genealogical research but primarily form part of our heritage and encourage acts of Respect and Remembrance, but they are currently being abused.

attributes.action: More funding for the NHS Blood Donation Service
attributes.background:
The NHS Blood donation service needs more direct funding. 

The service has cut services in the last few years, and regular blood donors are unable to find local sessions to make their donations, often waiting many months. This happens despite the regular appeals to for priority donors.
attributes.additional_details:
Regular donors, even priority donors, often have to wait for months to obtain an appointment to give blood.

The blood donation service has many reasons for an insecure blood supply stock: seasonal demand, lack of new donors, and relatively few donors from certain groups of the population. 

If the blood service continues to cut donor session availability, this could cause serious supply issues in certain vital blood stocks, such as O Negative, B Negative, and A Negative.

attributes.action: Amend Hate Speech Laws
attributes.background: "Hate Crime is any criminal offence [...] which is perceived to be motivated by hostility or prejudice." Law enforcement will find it difficult to fully determine the motivations behind the speech or actions. As such, the law should be changed to "proven to be motivated by" to avoid ambiguity.

attributes.action: Debate the government's adoption of the IHRA definition in its entirety.
attributes.background: The UK government to debate their decision to accept the IHRA definition of antisemitism in its entirety based on the observations of learned counsel & others that it is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Some people consider that the IHRA definition and the examples are poorly drafted, misleading, and could lead to the suppression of legitimate debate and freedom of expression.

attributes.action: Sugar Levy to be spent in schools educating about nutrition and healthy eating.
attributes.background: The Sugar Levy to be spent raising the profile of healthy eating & cooking in schools. Teaching the next generation how to cook proper healthy homemade meals. It is important to prevent the next generation developing health problems like Diabetes, obesity & heart disease.
attributes.additional_details: As a food teacher we have limited time to teach the basic skills to cook & why some foods aren't good for health. I am a diabetic who didn't understand the health implications of diet until it was too late as an adult. Families now have more than one adult at work, making time for cooking limited. The ease of ready meals & take aways mean people don’t get healthy nutritious meals or understand the risks of eating too much fat, sugar and salt & the quantities they are eating in their food.

attributes.action: QTS for Indian teachers.
attributes.background: Bachelor of Education degree (B.Ed.) must be recognised as QTS ( Qualified teacher status) in UK. In the same way as teaching degrees from EEA, US, Australia & New Zealand are recognised.
attributes.additional_details: The Indian education system has produced doctors, engineers and qualified professionals, working around the world. Ironic, that our teachers cannot work with their degree in UK, but can vote here!

attributes.action: All children should be tested for Autism before they are five years old
attributes.background: All children should be tested for Autism before they are five years old, following the Norway model, to ensure early diagnosis of autism and resultant improved life chances and educational outcomes

attributes.action: For Student Finance England to acknowledge their mistakes with payment errors!
attributes.background: In March 2018 2nd / 3rd year nursing & health care students from  universities in the UK were informed Student Finance England had mistakenly overpaid them and consequently blocked any further payments. We are aware the number of students affected is growing and could now have reached over 1000.
attributes.additional_details:
Students clarified their payment total but were reassured this was correct. Immediate payments are being demanded by SFE and have left students leaving their course due to financial pressures and is affecting the emotional wellbeing of students.

We would like: 
A public apology from SFE

To have repayment plans based on individuals circumstances

To cut interest charges on overpayments as compensation for distress

Financial support for 2nd year students to continue their training

attributes.action: Update the Fatal Accidents Act 1976 to help bereaved families.
attributes.background: The loss of a loved one following a fatal injury (accident or murder) drastically needs updating. We need to expand the number of family members who are entitled to a bereavement award and to increase the compensation which currently stands at £12,980. The  Law tells us who is entitled to claim.
attributes.additional_details:
Why does it need updating...? 

A wife can claim £12,980 for loss of her husband but nothing if she loses an adult child. If a child loses a parent, the child receives nothing. 

However celebrities can obtain over £200,000 for breach of privacy for phone hacking.

A person killed instantly in an accident or murdered is worth NOTHING.  

The cost of looking after a DOG is more than a bereavement award and more than life itself.

Please help bereaved families and children who have lost parents.

attributes.action: Call upon the British Government to stop Northern Ireland MLAs pay.
attributes.background: Northern Ireland MLAs are still being paid after yet again no agreement. People that are not doing work should not be paid and we all know it will encourage a deal to be made.

attributes.action: Make it a specific criminal offence to beg or busk with a dog in a public place
attributes.background: Chow dogs are being forced to sit in the heat for over 12 hours as the 'owner' begs for money. Gangs are breeding and importing the dogs for the use of 'entertainment ' to solicit funds. They are 'rented out', forced to urinate tied up, kept in hot vans, beaten and kicked in the head.
attributes.additional_details: Making the use of dogs and other animals for begging and busking a specific offence would make it much easier to bring the perpetrators of this sort of cruelty to justice.

attributes.action: Fix the date for coming out of the customs union and single market for Dec 2020
attributes.background: To stop the Government extending the leaving date of the customs union and single market. That we leave on December 2020 with no more implementation period or extended.

attributes.action: Recognise autism assistance dogs as an Assistance Service Dog like guide dogs.
attributes.background: Everywhere you go you see no dogs allowed except guide dogs. Obviously guide dogs help people see but for a child or adult who has additional needs or autism this helps them be more safe secure and make them more comfortable in surroundings they wouldn’t usually be comfortable in.
attributes.additional_details:
They have little sense of danger. 1 in 100 children in the UK are diagnosed with Autism. Half of these children will have a tendency to bolt and wander off, which can be very dangerous, and has often resulted in injuries to the child. 

Autism Assistance Dogs are trained to provide safety and companionship, helping to bring independence and a more socially inclusive Promote positive changes in behaviour Provide comfort for children when upset Reduce behavioural outbursts.

attributes.action: Have the A1 & A2 Motorcycle Licence automatically upgrade after 2 years
attributes.background:
Upgrade the A1 to a A2 after 2 years. 
Upgrade the A2 to a full licence after 2 years. 
Car drivers can drive a vehicle with any power after one test, why can't us bikers? 
At least with 2 years experience of each licence, surely that is enough experience to be given the privilege to move up.
attributes.additional_details: Bikers must complete a CBT test for a 125. Then another test for the A1 licence, that is for a 125 again. It consists of a theory test, a module 1 and a module 2. Then bikers have to wait to be older anyway to go for the A2 licence that again consists of a module 1 & a module 2 , then for the full A licence they must do another module 1 and module 2 test. To prepare for the tests, training is needed consisting at least 5 lessons costing a bomb and taking up alot your time. It's over kill.

attributes.action: Only allow students to register to vote in one constituency
attributes.background: In the 2017 general election students registered to vote in their town and university town. I would like them to only be able to register to vote in one constituency in general elections.

attributes.action:
Prevent child abduction and work to ensure abducted children are
repatriated.
attributes.background: Approximately 500 cases of International Parental Child Abduction take place each year (that equates to ten a week) - these are figures from the FCO. Exit controls at the border were abolished in 1998, so court orders, alerts and other safeguards to prevent abduction cannot be effectively enforced.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government must raise awareness of the problem with public
authorities so that they can formulate more effective preventative
measures.

The Government must introduce a fully funded team dedicated to liaising with foreign Governments and fund legal action abroad to ensure that children are repatriated to the UK. The Government must implement the recommendations of the Law Commission to reform of sections 1 and 2 of the Child Abduction Act 1984.

attributes.action: Have Dartford Crossing contribute towards the cost of the lower Thames crossing.
attributes.background: The public was told the Dartford Crossing was to be made free back in 1999. 19 years later we're still being charged. For this reason alone i believe it would be fair to have money from Dartford crossing to go towards some of the lower Thames build.

attributes.action: Extend Sunday trading hours
attributes.background: To increase the trading hours to match the other 6 days of the week would increase revenue and employment. Sunday trading laws are out dated and the product of an old fashioned mindset.

attributes.action: Increase Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) from 39 weeks to 52 weeks
attributes.background: It is important that new parents should not be put off taking their full entitlement to Maternity Leave for 52 weeks because they will not receive payment for the last 13 weeks of their leave. Currently SMP is only payable for the first 39 weeks of Maternity Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
The House of Commons Library contains a document entitled "Maternity pay and leave" dated 13 January 2010. It states that in December 2004 the Government announced a goal of extending maternity pay to twelve
months, from what was then 26 weeks (6 months). Although progress has been made and maternity pay is now paid for 39 weeks (9 months), I believe it is an important social issue to get that extra extension to 52 weeks (12 months).

attributes.action: Reduce the TV license fee and privatise the BBC
attributes.background:
The BBC was created as a government funded TV channel when there were very few other options. Today, with hundreds of alternative channels, the BBC is not needed.

The TV license should ONLY be for maintenance of broadcasting equipment, and the BBC should be self funded like all other TV channels.
attributes.additional_details:
Our proposal is to make the BBC a privately funded channel, as all others are, with commercials and/or subscription fees. Approximately 11% of license fees are spent on the infrastructure and broadcasting equipment, the rest is spent on BBC programming and administation,  and chasing license fees. 

By making the BBC private, more people will be able to watch live TV without having to pay a hefty fee for a service they don't use.

attributes.action: Condemn the Israeli government killing innocent civilians and unarmed protesters
attributes.background: Condemn the Israeli government for killing innocent people like the 21 year old nurse who was shot dead on 1/06/18 by Israeli soldiers while treating injured Palestinian protesters.
attributes.additional_details:
The death of this nurse cannot go un noticed. This killing must stop and there is more the British government can do to ease matters into peace.  

Targeting medics let alone unarmed protesters is a war crime under the ***Geneva Convention***.

attributes.action: Exempt SME's from GDPR or provide tax allowance to offset the cost of compliance
attributes.background: The introduction of GDPR creates compliance and continuing costs to SME's. It is recognised that implementation has already cost billions, disproportionately for SMES. It seriously damages Export and the Service sectors. An appropriate incentive by a tax allowance to offset ongoing costs will assist
attributes.additional_details: US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross has stated that the “GDPR “significantly interrupts transatlantic co-operation - creates unnecessary barriers to trade for everyone outside the EU". He expressed his "deep concern" about the EU's latest regulatory nightmare warning it will "significantly interrupt transatlantic co-operation, create unnecessary barriers to trade for everyone outside the EU". The costs do and will fall disproportionately on small and medium-sized businesses.

attributes.action: Amnesty for illegal immigrants who have been in UK for 7 years
attributes.background: People who lived here more than 7 years have a huge social circle. Everyone is connected to each other. Deporting these immigrants will leave a very bad impact on their familes and local community. If they are legally allowed, govt will get huge revenue in terms of income tax and national insurance.
